it.ismb.pertlab.ogc.sensorthings.api.datamodel

Class Datastream

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.ismb.pertlab.ogc.sensorthings.api.datamodel.Datastream

  • public class Datastream
extends Object
    Definition: A datastream groups a collection of observations that are related in some way. The one constraint is that the observations in a datastream must measure the same observed property (i.e., one phenomenon).
    Author:
    Dario Bonino

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Datastream()
      Empty constructor, respects the bean instantiation pattern
      Datastream(String description, Thing thing, ObservedProperty observedProperty)
      Builds a new datastream instance with the given description, belongin to the given thing and involving the given observed property.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Datastream

        public Datastream()
        Empty constructor, respects the bean instantiation pattern

      • Datastream

        public Datastream(String description,
          Thing thing,
          ObservedProperty observedProperty)
        Builds a new datastream instance with the given description, belongin to the given thing and involving the given observed property.
        Parameters:
        description - The description (String) of the datastream entity. The content is open to support other description languages.
        thing - The Thing instance generating this stream of data.
        observedProperty - The ObservedProperty about which are observations belonging to this datastream.

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()
        Provides the description of the datastream entity. The content is open to support other description languages.
        Returns:
        the description

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(String description)
        Sets the description of the datastream entity. The content is open to support other description languages.
        Parameters:
        description - the description to set, as a String.

      • getThing

        public Thing getThing()
        Provides the Thing instance to which the datastream belongs.
        Returns:
        the thing

      • setThing

        public void setThing(Thing thing)
        Sets the Thing instance to which the datastream must belong.
        Parameters:
        thing - the thing to set

      • getObservations

        public Set<Observation> getObservations()
        Provides a Live reference to the list of observations belonging to this Datastream instance. The underlying data structure is not Thread-safe, therefore synchronization and concurrent modification issues might arise in multi-threaded environments.
        Returns:
        the live reference to the inner Set<Observation>.

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(Set<Observation> observations)
        Updates the Set<Observation> gbelonging to this Datastream instance. Any previously existing information is discarded.
        Parameters:
        observations - the observations to set.

      • addObservation

        public void addObservation(Observation observation)
        Adds a single Observation to the set of observations belonging to this Datastream instance.
        Parameters:
        observation - The observation to add.

      • removeObservation

        public boolean removeObservation(Observation observation)
        Removes a single Observation from the set of observations belonging to this Datastream instance.
        Parameters:
        observation - The observation to remove.
        Returns:
        true if removal was successful, false otherwise

      • getObservedProperty

        public ObservedProperty getObservedProperty()
        Provides the ObservedProperty instance describing the property to which observations belonging to this data stream belong.
        Returns:
        the observedProperty

      • setObservedProperty

        public void setObservedProperty(ObservedProperty observedProperty)
        Sets the ObservedProperty instance describing the property to which observations belonging to this data stream belong.
        Parameters:
        observedProperty - the observedProperty to set
